meanings.definition: To complain or grumble in a bad-tempered way.
meanings.sent1: She grumped about having to do her chores.
meanings.sent2: He always grumped when it was time to clean his room.
meanings.sent3: The cat grumped at the rain outside.
meanings.sent4: The old car grumped as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The teacher grumped at the messy desks in the classroom.

meanings.definition: To be in a bad mood or show dissatisfaction.
meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he grumped for hours.
meanings.sent2: She grumped all morning after burning her toast.
meanings.sent3: The grumped toddler refused to eat his vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds grumped across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The tired dog grumped as it curled up for a nap.

meanings.sent1: He grumped about the slow service at the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: She grumped at the noisy neighbors next door.
meanings.sent3: The grumped customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent4: The engine grumped as it struggled to start.
meanings.sent5: The student grumped about the difficult test.
